pages.text: The $(thing)Charcoal Pit$() is the main method of obtaining $(item)Charcoal$(), which is the main source of $(l:basic_smithing/forge)fuel$() in TFC. To build a charcoal pit, we must first create a $(item)log pile$() by $(4)shift+right-clicking$() with some logs.

Put most simply, the charcoal pit is a structure of log piles covered by non-flammable solid blocks. You will want to dig a small hole in the ground, and fill it with log piles (each with 16 logs, to maximize output). Then, cover the piles with a solid block (dirt works best). Then, remove one covering block to expose a log pile, and drop a $(item)torch$() on it. Wait a few seconds until it lights, then cover the exposed log pile and wait. After, you can dig the charcoal that's left with a shovel.
This is a simple 1x1 charcoal pit. For the amount of time it takes to burn, it's pretty inefficient. But hey, it works!
This is an example of a larger charcoal pit you can try. However, almost any shape will work!
The Stick Bunch is used to store sticks. It can be cooked into torches.
The Stick Bundle is for all intents and purposes a kind of log. You can use it to make charcoal pits as well as cook it in a firepit.
